comments.body:
I'd like to see this being consistent across all commands, have you checked all the examples if they are similar?
/lgtm cancel
Thanks for your comments.I took a look for all help information about Kubectl.This seems not to exist in others.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +59,63 @@
		# Return snapshot logs from all containers in pods defined by label app=nginx
		kubectl logs -l app=nginx --all-containers=true

		# Return snapshot of previous terminated ruby container logs from pod web-1

comments.body:
From this function we must return number of bytes (`n`) written from `p`, where `n` must be `0 <= n <= len(p)`to meet the `io.Writer` interface requirements.

`return pw.writer.Write(append(pw.prefix, p...))` will be violating the `io.Writer` interface: it can return `n > len(p)` because we write `p` and `pw.prefix`. Other packages/functions will misbehave if we do that (I had issues with `io.Copy` which compares number of bytes internally, for example).
